name: Programming Fundamentals
description: Welcome to Phase 2! This phase is all about programming with Python and building real applications. Programming is a fundamental skill for cloud engineering, enabling you to create, manage, and optimize cloud resources efficiently. You'll build a working API with database integration—the foundation for everything that follows.
short_description: Learn Python programming, REST APIs, FastAPI, and databases. Build a real-world Journal API project.
additional_context: You don't need to know how to build UIs but you need to know how to work with APIs and databases. Focus on understanding the code you write—avoid using AI assistants for code completion in this phase. You'll learn to use those tools effectively in Phase 3.
objectives: Learned the basics of programming and Python
Learned the basics of how REST APIs work
Learned how to work with PostgreSQL and SQLAlchemy
Learned how to call external APIs (including LLM APIs)

capstone.title: Learning Journal API
capstone.summary: Build a working FastAPI + PostgreSQL API and integrate an LLM for entry analysis. This project becomes the foundation for later phases.
includes: Fork the starter repo and implement the Journal API
Integrate an LLM provider for analysis

hands_on_verification.summary: Prove your Journal API works locally and that you can use basic API workflows.
includes: Create at least one entry via POST /entries
Paste a valid JSON response from GET /entries

warning: As learners finish this phase, many will share their code. We recommend you do not copy and paste anybody's solution. You are only doing a disservice to yourself and will not make it in this field if that is the mentality you have. Additionally, we recommend you turn off any AI assistants for code completion—you need to build muscle memory and understanding first. Using AI to ask for explanations is fine, but write your own code.
